title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco and Brandon Baez were sentenced to federal prison for mail theft and check fraud in Massachusetts.
Rios-Franco received 35 months in prison and must pay $12,528 restitution; Baez received two years and must pay $10,285.
From June 2023 to February 2024, they washed checks stolen from mailboxes and deposited them into controlled accounts.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Marcelo Gomes da Silva, detained by ICE in 2025, is invited to the State of the Union by Rep. Seth Moulton.
Gomes, a Milford High student from Brazil, was detained after his visa expired without his knowledge.
Detained for six days, Gomes faced poor conditions; his arrest sparked local protests and community support.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a center-ice goal against Denmark in his first Olympic start for Team USA.
Swayman humorously dismissed concerns about visibility issues, citing his color blindness after the goal.
Despite Swayman's performance, Team USA defeated Denmark, with Swayman making 18 saves in the win.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum's potential return from an Achilles injury is generating discussion at the NBA All-Star event.
Kevin Durant, who has recovered from a similar injury, predicts Tatum will return at an All-Star level performance.
Carmelo Anthony believes Tatum's return will be strategically advantageous, reducing the focus on team reintegration.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space to address key positions in free agency.
Alec Pierce, leading NFL in yards per reception, is a top wide receiver option for the Patriots.
Signing Ravens EDGE Jaelan Phillips could strengthen Patriots' defense with high pressure stats.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN and MLB.TV have partnered to make ESPN their new streaming platform for MLB games starting this season.
MLB.TV is an add-on for ESPN Unlimited subscribers, costing $134.99, or $149.99 for non-subscribers with one free month.
Existing MLB.TV accounts renew automatically, with options to stream via the MLB app or ESPN's app after account linking.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a G League practice with the Maine Celtics, fueling speculation about his return from an Achilles injury.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement about Tatum's progress, noting Tatum looked like himself during the practice.
Despite the practice, Celtics president Brad Stevens reiterated Tatum won't return until fully ready, with no set timetable provided.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts is ranked as the most educated state in the 2026 WalletHub analysis.
The state leads in adults holding bachelor's (47%) and graduate (22%) degrees.
Vermont and Maryland ranked second and third; Louisiana, Mississippi, West Virginia ranked last.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare T206 Honus Wagner baseball card, connected to Massachusetts, is currently up for auction, closing on Feb. 21.
The card, owned by Dennis and Douglas Shields, was initially pulled from a cigarette pack by their grandfather in the early 1900s.
Ken Goldin, of Netflix's "King of Collectibles," is handling the auction, with the current bid at $4.758 million including fees.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will start in goal for Team USA against Denmark in the 2026 Winter Olympics.
Swayman previously helped Team USA win the IIHF World Championship in 2025 with a 5-0 record.
Boston Bruins teammate Charlie McAvoy also plays for Team USA, paired with Quinn Hughes in defense.
